domanda: What is the primary goal of Responsible AI?

risposte.a: To maximize profits from AI systems.
risposte.b: To develop AI systems as quickly as possible.
risposte.c: To ensure AI systems are safe, trustworthy, and ethical.
risposte.d: To replace human decision-making with AI.

domanda: Which principle is NOT one of the six identified by Microsoft for Responsible AI?

risposte.a: Fairness.
risposte.b: Innovation.
risposte.c: Inclusiveness.
risposte.d: Accountability.

domanda: What does the principle of Fairness in Responsible AI emphasize?

risposte.a: Maximizing AI performance at all costs.
risposte.b: Ensuring AI systems perform equally well across all demographic groups.
risposte.c: Prioritizing profitability over ethical concerns.
risposte.d: Creating AI systems that are easy to understand.

domanda: How does Microsoft address potential biases in AI systems?

risposte.a: By ignoring the issue and focusing on other areas.
risposte.b: By providing AI systems with more data.
risposte.c: By reviewing training data, testing with balanced samples, and using adversarial debiasing.
risposte.d: By allowing users to modify AI system outputs directly.

domanda: What is the role of transparency in Microsoft's Responsible AI principles?

risposte.a: To keep AI operations secret from the public.
risposte.b: To make AI systems' operations and decisions understandable and clear.
risposte.c: To hide the limitations of AI systems.
risposte.d: To prioritize efficiency over ethical considerations.

domanda: Why is it important for developers to closely scrutinize AI-generated code?

risposte.a: To reduce development time.
risposte.b: To ensure that the code aligns with project-specific conventions and requirements.
risposte.c: To enhance the creative aspect of coding.
risposte.d: To automatically improve system performance.

domanda: What is GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: GitHub Copilot is an AI pair programmer that you can use to get code suggestions.
risposte.b: GitHub Copilot is OpenAI Codex, a new AI system that OpenAI created.
risposte.c: GitHub Copilot is a JavaScript public repository and is one of the best-supported languages.
risposte.d: GitHub Copilot can write a comment that describes logic, and you can add your suggested code to implement the solution.

domanda: What are the supported IDE extensions for GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: VS Code and Visual Studio
risposte.b: GitHub.com, VS Code, Visual Studio, Neovim, and JetBrains
risposte.c: VS Code, Visual Studio, Neovim, and JetBrains
risposte.d: GitHub.com and JetBrains only

domanda: What is the difference between GitHub Copilot Business and GitHub Copilot Enterprise?

risposte.a: GitHub Copilot Enterprise has code completions, whereas GitHub Copilot Business doesn't.
risposte.b: GitHub Copilot Enterprise has chat in IDE and mobile, whereas GitHub Copilot Business doesn't.
risposte.c: GitHub Copilot Enterprise has an extra layer of personalization. Organizations use their own codebase to train GitHub Copilot.
risposte.d: GitHub Copilot Enterprise has an extra layer of security, with IP indemnity and enterprise-grade security, safety, and privacy.

domanda: What's GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: A platform for code repositories.
risposte.b: A model powered by machine learning.
risposte.c: An assistant for coding, powered by OpenAI.
risposte.d: A service for web hosting.

domanda: What role does prompting play in utilizing GitHub Copilot effectively?

risposte.a: It generates instant bug fixes.
risposte.b: It enhances the quality of code suggestions.
risposte.c: It automates the coding process entirely.
risposte.d: It implements real-time collaboration.

domanda: Which of the following rules is a principle of the 4S Method of prompt engineering?

risposte.a: Summarize code objectives concisely.
risposte.b: Specify instructions explicitly and in detail.
risposte.c: Streamline processes for efficient code suggestions.
risposte.d: Simplify coding languages for universal understanding.

domanda: How does GitHub Copilot handle personal data?

risposte.a: It saves all personal data for future references.
risposte.b: It shares personal data with other users for collaborative projects.
risposte.c: It encrypts personal data.
risposte.d: It actively filters out personal data to protect user privacy.

domanda: What is LoRA in the context of fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs)?

risposte.a: A method that adds trainable elements to each layer of the pretrained model without a complete overhaul.
risposte.b: A technology optimizing communication between different coding languages.
risposte.c: A specialized software library enhancing Copilot's performance.
risposte.d: A new programming paradigm supported exclusively by Copilot.

domanda: How does Copilot use the context to provide code suggestions?

risposte.a: It considers only the prompt text you provide.
risposte.b: It considers the file type but not the content of the file.
risposte.c: It considers the surrounding code, file type, and content of parallel open tabs in the code editor.
risposte.d: It randomly selects context from the internet.

domanda: Which of these strategies helps to improve prompt effectiveness in GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Providing detailed contextual information with clarity.
risposte.b: Making the prompt as general as possible.
risposte.c: Keeping the prompt lengthy and detailed.
risposte.d: Avoiding examples in the prompt to not restrict Copilot's creativity.

domanda: What is ghost text in GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Ghost text in GitHub Copilot are suggestions that appear in your text editor as you type.
risposte.b: Ghost text in GitHub Copilot are options used when typing to provide suggestions.
risposte.c: Ghost text in GitHub Copilot involves using prompts and natural language questions within your code or documentation.
risposte.d: Ghost text is Copilot's log of all previous completions.

domanda: How do you access GitHub Copilot's inline chat?

risposte.a: Access the inline chat by clicking on the chat icon in the left sidebar of Visual Studio Code.
risposte.b: Use Ctrl+i on Windows or Command+i on a Mac to open the inline chat.
risposte.c: Access the inline chat by using Alt+i on Windows or Option+i on a Mac.
risposte.d: Click the GitHub Copilot logo in the menu bar.

domanda: What are slash commands used for in GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Slash commands are used to format your codebase according to best practices.
risposte.b: Slash commands are used to debug code and detect security vulnerabilities within your projects.
risposte.c: Slash commands are shortcuts to quickly solve common development tasks within the chat or inline pane.
risposte.d: Slash commands are used to connect GitHub Copilot with third-party tools.

domanda: What are the benefits of using agents like '@terminal' or '@workspace' when interacting with GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Agents in Visual Studio Code help you ask questions within a specific context, allowing for more precise and relevant answers from GitHub Copilot.
risposte.b: Agents help enforce a consistent code format based on best practices within Visual Studio Code for improved readability.
risposte.c: Agents provide extra security features for detecting vulnerabilities and intrusions within Visual Studio Code projects.
risposte.d: Agents execute GitHub Actions workflows from chat.

domanda: What are the benefits of using implicit prompts with slash commands in inline chat for fixing code issues with GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Implicit prompts help enforce a consistent naming convention and syntax based on best practices within Visual Studio Code projects for improved readability.
risposte.b: Implicit prompts help get better responses from GitHub Copilot without writing longer prompts, making it easier to interact and fix code issues.
risposte.c: Implicit prompts help detect security vulnerabilities and potential malicious activities within Visual Studio Code projects for increased safety.
risposte.d: Implicit prompts generate full documentation based on file headers.

domanda: Which of the following choices isn't mentioned as one of the programming languages receiving strong support from GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: Python
risposte.b: JavaScript
risposte.c: Rust
risposte.d: Ruby

domanda: Which slash command in GitHub Copilot Chat is used to generate unit tests for selected code?

risposte.a: /generate
risposte.b: /test
risposte.c: /tests
risposte.d: /unittest

domanda: What is the purpose of the @workspace agent in GitHub Copilot Chat?

risposte.a: To focus only on the current file
risposte.b: To extend the context of questions to the whole project
risposte.c: To run terminal commands
risposte.d: To change Visual Studio Code settings

domanda: What command would you use to get an explanation of a specific command using GitHub Copilot CLI?

risposte.a: gh copilot suggest
risposte.b: gh copilot explain
risposte.c: gh copilot clarify
risposte.d: gh copilot describe

domanda: Which GitHub Copilot plan includes enterprise-grade security and privacy?

risposte.a: Pro
risposte.b: Business
risposte.c: Enterprise
risposte.d: Both B and C

domanda: What should you do if GitHub Copilot isn't providing code suggestions?

risposte.a: Restart the computer
risposte.b: Check the internet connection
risposte.c: Disable the Copilot extension
risposte.d: Change the programming language

domanda: What is the purpose of the content exclusion feature in GitHub Copilot?

risposte.a: To enhance code completion accuracy
risposte.b: To prevent specific files or repositories from being used for code suggestions
risposte.c: To increase the speed of code suggestions
risposte.d: To provide legal protection against IP claims
